revised_title: Electron-Resonance Studies of Haemoglobin Derivatives: Haem-Plane Orientation
tldr: The authors used electron-resonance techniques to study haemoglobin derivatives and determine the orientation of haem planes within the molecules. They found that the four haem groups in a haemoglobin molecule are not parallel, with some having their normals aligned with the direction of nearest approach to neighboring molecules.
